reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the collection of data.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app collects various types of information, indicating that it declares the collection of data.
reply.reference: We collect information from and about users of our App. Directly from you when you provide it to us. Automatically when you use the App. URL: https://ontarget.helpscoutdocs.com/article/383-privacy-policy

Our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting, and disclosing that information.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Usage Details, Device Information, Stored Information and Files, and Location Information.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions the specific types of data collected by the app under the section 'Automatic Information Collection and Tracking.'
reply.reference: Usage Details. When you access and use the App, we may automatically collect certain details of your access to and use of the App, including traffic data, location data, logs, and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on or through the App. Device Information. We may collect information about your mobile device and internet connection, including the device's unique device identifier, IP address, operating system, browser type, mobile network information, and the device's telephone number. Stored Information and Files. The App also may access metadata and other information associated with other files stored on your device. This may include, for example, photographs, audio and video clips, personal contacts, and address book information. Location Information. This App collects real-time information about the location of your device for EVV Services where required. URL: https://ontarget.helpscoutdocs.com/article/383-privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data by sending an email to support@ontargetclinical.com to request access to, correct, or delete any personal information provided. However, deleting personal information requires deleting the user account, and requests to change information may not be accommodated if they violate laws or legal requirements.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users can opt out of data collection or delete data by sending an email to the specified address. However, deleting personal information involves deleting the user account, and certain requests for information changes may not be accommodated under specific circumstances.
reply.reference: You may also send us an email at support@ontargetclinical.com to request access to, correct, or delete any personal information that you have provided to us. We cannot delete your personal information except by also deleting your user account. We may not accommodate a request to change information if we believe the change would violate any law or legal requirement or cause the information to be incorrect. URL: https://ontarget.helpscoutdocs.com/article/383-privacy-policy

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy mentions that certain third parties may collect information about users or their devices when using the app. These third parties may use tracking technologies and collect personal information for advertising purposes.
reply.reference: When you use the App or its content, certain third parties may use automatic information collection technologies to collect information about you or your device. These third parties include: Google Services: https://policies.google.com/privacy, Your mobile device manufacturer, Your mobile service provider. If you have any questions about an advertisement or other targeted content, you should contact the responsible provider directly. URL: https://ontarget.helpscoutdocs.com/article/383-privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: Google Services, mobile device manufacturers, and mobile service providers are the third parties that the app shares data with.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy explicitly mentions Google Services, mobile device manufacturers, and mobile service providers as the third parties with whom data is shared.
reply.reference: These third parties include: Google Services: https://policies.google.com/privacy Your mobile device manufacturer. Your mobile service provider. URL: https://ontarget.helpscoutdocs.com/article/383-privacy-policy
